result.execSummary:
The defendant Kreg A Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (Unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.   Cooperate with the Child Support Agency  to pay child support and make all court appearances.  May Not have contact with Ethan P unless otherwise permitted by the court.** May not reside with Heather P while he is married to someone else***
No contact with anyone under 18 yrs unless related by blood without courts permission.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH. Huber allowed.Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

received from Jeanette B requesting the deft be allowed contact w/her children

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person pro se.  Case brought to court today on deft's request to have contact E.P. (DOB 3/9/06).  Court takes no action since a letter was received from the mother of E.P. which does not support allowing contact.  Deft requests to have contact w/his girlfriend's children; brief discussion held.  Deft will need to submit a letter from a therapist that contact with these children would be in the children's best interest, input from the child(ren) father(s), & there is some permanence to this relationship.
from Heather P.
Hearing on April 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3 years.  See conditions.  Deft sentenced to 6mos KCJ as a condition of probation commencing forthwith.  Deft taken into custody.  Huber allowed.   It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning
from Pathways Consulting

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Aileen Henry.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 5/27/15 @ 2pm.
Email received from Atty Henry - case is settled; time of hrg moved to 3:45pm for plea per email to both attys

Defendant, Kreg A Davis, appeared with Attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Atty Henry to inform the court by 03-31-15 if the matter is resolved; matter remains on the Court's trial calendar at this time. Bond continued.
Regarding use of videotaped statements

Minutes:  NO FILE IN COURT.  NO RECORD TAKEN.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft present along w/Atty Henry.  New dates given along w/co-deft case (Heather Padilla).  FPT 3/26/15 @ 10:30am, JS 4/13/15 @ 9am

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-11-15 @ 1:30pm. Jury selection on 3-2-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
